We may earn commission from links on this page, but we only recommend products we love. Promise. Love Island USAseason 7is in full swing. And as singles begin pairing up, hooking up, and competing for that sweet $100,000 prize, all the fans have to do is enjoy the drama and vote for their faves. Eliminations aren't on a consistent schedule, so if you care about who wins, you need to know how to vote forLove Island USA. **How can you vote forLove Island USAseason 7?** Because it's 2025 and not the early oughts, there's no number to call or website to log onto. If you want to vote for theLove Island USAwinner, you have to download the officialLove Island USAapp. Available on bothGoogle Playand Apple, theLove Island USAapp will alert you when voting is open so you can be sure never to miss a chance to support your fave Islanders and couples. **‘Love Island USA’** Not only is theLove Island USAapp the only way to vote, it also gives users access to tons of BTS content, as well as exclusive access to clips and features like polls and quizzes. And, no, it doesn't cost you a dime. However, you do need to register your phone number to be able to vote. **How often can you vote forLove Island USA?** Unlike other reality shows—yourBachelors, yourAmerican Idols—Love Island USAeliminations aren't on a specific schedule. So you can't always anticipate when you'll be allowed to vote for your fave contestants (or couples), which makes downloading the app crucial to your participation.Love Island USAairs pretty much every day (except Wednesdays), and the app can keep you in the loop even if you miss an episode. The dating show also doesn't allow for multiplevoting, so don't forget to think long and hard about who you want to support before hitting that vote button! **Does your vote matter?** Voters don't always get the final say on eliminations from theLove Island USAvilla. As contestants date and swap partners, some people will get left behind with or without your vote. That said, it was fan voting that determined last season's winners, Kordell Beckham and Serena Page.
